activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#13799
activity.text: > > Here is the ss, see the `Required` here for both start time and end time is being thrown by zod not our custom error message which is `This field is required` yup, went through the issue and made the changes. Reason: in the form, when the time input is empty, React Hook Form passes `undefined` (not an empty string ""), so Zod's missing field validation runs first, before it even gets to `.min(1)`¬†validation. so added `{ required_error: "..." }` parameter because we need both `{ required_error: "..." }`: for undefined values and `.min(1, message)` : for empty strings

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#13382
activity.text:
> > [@AdityaJ2305](https://github.com/AdityaJ2305), this has been fixed here [#13297](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/pull/13297)
> > for detail explanation - [comment](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/issues/13261#issuecomment-3157252838)
> 
> one more thing , just checked the changes, changes fixed it but they are falling back to undefined on having null to adhere frontend schema but backend schema has string | null

in my case APIs expect optional fields to be either omitted or set as undefined rather than sent as empty strings ("") or null

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#13382
activity.text:
> [@Denyme24](https://github.com/Denyme24) , oh ok but I want to confirm one thing , Are we now using string | null for description ? if yes, then we need to make changes many places in fronted like passing null as default instead of undefined, empty string for description and update zod to z.string().nullable() all that because we always try to match backend
> 
> I think [@nandkishorr](https://github.com/nandkishorr) could confirm

@AdityaJ2305 yes, we are using `.nullable()`,
and this mostly happens in edit mode, where FE expects a valid `string` or `undefined`(in some cases) , but BE returns `null`, so the schema validation fails, and lead to this validation failure.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12916
activity.text:
> > Hey @sj11105 , i have addressed this issue (button enable/disable) in this [PR](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/pull/13238) for both `DiscountForm` and `DiscountMonetaryComponent` and for healthcare service form this is being done here #13243. im almost done with all the forms will raise a PR for this EOD. and i currently see `test failed` label on this PR
> 
> Hey, yes but the changes were approved and the test failed case I have asked about that also but didn't get any reply , so was waiting for it.

Cool, but there are couple of issues with your approach
- First of all, you have removed `isPending` that will allow user to make multiple submission while the request is in progress.
- there's a Form state mismatch, so when you open the form in edit mode and make a single change in the `code` or even in `Name` Field that would still not be counted as a dirty state because you are using both isDirty and isValid without explicitly adding a condition for edit mode. 
- translation keys issue not addressed (though it was not the part of your issue, just saying because i have addressed it)

here's the deploy preview video of your changes with the issues: 

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3fdb8872-bda9-4cf3-bbb0-42616a4fb4ab

for both `DiscountForm` and `DiscountMonetaryComponent` and for healthcare service form this is being done here https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/issues/13243. im almost done with all the forms will raise a PR for this EOD. and i currently see `test failed` label on this PR

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#13266
activity.text:
Hey @yadavshubham01, i have fixed this issue while working on this issue #13243, because my Button enable/disable logic depends on it which I'm currently working on it.
For more detail about please check this [comment](https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/issues/13261#issuecomment-3157252838)

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#13261
activity.text:
Hey @StephZam, thank you for pointing it out, however while working on this #13243, i have already modify the logic for `derived_from_uri` because it is connected to the button enable/disable logic (which i'm currently working on). the issue was when we start type in something in that field and then clear it, it is being treated as valid url `""` and zod schema tries to validate this URL. 
and in edit mode not just `derived_from_uri` even  `Description` and `Purpose` would give this similar required error (even though they are optional) due to data mismatch. The problem is that `description` and `purpose` fields can be null in the database, but our validation schema doesn't handle null values. So i have fixed that as well.

you can close this one as completed.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#13219
ohcnetwork/care_fe#13219
activity.text:
Hey Team @rithviknishad @Jacobjeevan.  if this is valid, i would like to work on it.
Root cause: The problem is that the Zod schema is defined outside the component where the `useTranslation()` hook isn't available, so the validation messages are using raw translation keys instead of translated text.

Solution: Move the schema definition inside the component using `useMemo` hook.

ETA: 1 day

activity.text:

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#13179
activity.text:
> @Denyme24 , we can keep the alert logic to ValuesetSelectContent file only right ?

well @AdityaJ2305 i also thought about this before making the changes but,
I think it makes more sense to keep the alert logic in the parent component, `ValueSetSelect`, rather than pushing it down into `ValueSetSearchContent`. That way, we stick to the single responsibility principle, `ValueSetSearchContent` can stay focused purely on handling the UI and search logic, without getting tied up in user actions or confirmation flows.

This also makes `ValueSetSearchContent` way more reusable, since it‚Äôs not carrying around any alert-specific logic that might not be needed in other contexts. All the confirmation handling stays in one place, the parent which keeps things cleaner and easier to manage. It‚Äôs a better separation of concerns: the child displays stuff, and the parent deals with what to do when users interact with it.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12891
activity.text:
Hey Team @Jacobjeevan, @rithviknishad , i have fixed the issue locally . **Issue:** OTP error message didn‚Äôt update on language switch because the translated string was stored in state. Before: `const [otpError, setOtpError] = useState(""); ` `setOtpError(t("send_otp_error")); ` `{otpError &&

{otpError}

}` But Changing language didn‚Äôt update the error text, it stayed in the old language. so now we Store a boolean flag instead, and call t() during render: `const [otpError, setOtpError] = useState(false);` `setOtpError(true); ` `{otpError &&

{t("send_otp_error")}

}` and also added the missing translation keys in the language files. Now, the message updates automatically when the language changes. https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8e6b464f-4fb2-4521-9428-e05ef15cba39

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12509
activity.text:
@rithviknishad, I gave the suggested approach a try, but I ran into a limitation with React Hook Form‚Äôs onChange mode. It only re-validates the field that was updated, so when manufacture_date changes, it doesn‚Äôt automatically re-validate expiration_date, even though it's dependent on the updated value.

Because of that, the validation logic didn‚Äôt work as expected with this method. I‚Äôm happy to explore alternative solutions if needed

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12403
activity.text:
Hi team, looking to make my first contribution! My approach:

Made the following changes:

* Added red asterisk for required fields in Location and Department forms using Tailwind CSS.
* Updated button disable logic:

  * Location form: disabled if unchanged or invalid.
  * Department form: disabled if unchanged or loading.
* Used React Hook Form's `isValid` and `isDirty` for validation.

EOD: Changes done locally and self reviewed.

Approach:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b8d82f5f-f83b-4faf-9bbc-4abb9dcfd329
